pages.title: Fuel Rod
pages.text: The Fuel Rods are placed inside your Reactor in long horizontal or vertical piles.$(br2)They act as a reservoir of reactants (either fuel or waste or a mix of the two) and are irradiated while the Reactor is turned on to generate the heat that ultimately will be converted to energy or used to vaporize coolants.

The first Fuel Rod of each pile must follow a $(l:bigreactors:reactor/part-casing)Casing block$(/l) and the last Fuel Rod of each pile must the followed by a $(l:bigreactors:reactor/part-controlrod)Control Rod$(/l).$(br2)You can make all your Fuel Rod piles vertical (following the Y axis) or horizontal (following either the X or Z axis) but you can't mix and match.$(br2)Note that as a consequence of this requirement, all your Control Rods must be placed on the same face of the Reactor.
$(l)Mandatory:$() yes$(br)$(l)Valid positions:$() inside the Reactor$(br)$(l)Variants:$() all$(br)$(l)Graphical interface:$() no
